DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Radiography Evidence Brain Metastasis External Hippocampus Present Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator related to the presence of brain metastases outside 5-mm margin around either hippocampus visible on a MRI

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Radiography Evidence Brain Metastasis External Hippocampus Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Information related the presence of brain metastases outside 5-mm margin around either hippocampus visible on a MRI

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredName: Radiography Evidence Brain Metastasis External Hippocampus Present
Property.preferredDefinition: A radiographic procedure using the emission of x-rays to form an image of the structure penetrated by the radiation.:Knowledge on which to base belief.:An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.:The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.:Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.:A curved gray matter structure of the temporal lobe lying on the floor of the lateral ventricle of the brain.:Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

Concepts.definition: A radiographic procedure using the emission of x-rays to form an image of the structure penetrated by the radiation.
Knowledge on which to base belief.
An organ composed of grey and white matter containing billions of neurons that is the center for intelligence and reasoning. It is protected by the bony cranium.

The spread or migration of cancer cells from one part of the body (the organ in which it first appeared) to another. The secondary tumor contains cells that are like those in the original (primary) tumor.
Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.
A curved gray matter structure of the temporal lobe lying on the floor of the lateral ventricle of the brain.
Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have brain m
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have brain metastases outside a 5-mm margin around either hippocampus must be visible on contrast-enhanced MRI performed less than or equal to 21 days prior to Step 1 registration

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF_TEXT2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have 10 or fewer brain metastases <= 3 cm in largest diameter outside a 5-mm margin around either hippocampus that are visible on contrast-enhanced MRI performed less than or equal to 21 days prior to Step 1 registration and meets all other constraints in 3.1.2?
